intro: Rorippa divaricata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved watercress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard plants. The plant typically grows in moist or aquatic environments, such as stream banks and wet meadows. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It produces small white or yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by pods that contain several seeds.
